3    |  ** 									     **
4    |  **   Modules Revision 3.0						     **
5    |  **   Providing a flexible user environment				     **
6    |  ** 									     **
7    |  **   File:		ModuleCmd_Refresh.c				     **
8    |  **   First Edition:	2005/06/02					     **
9    |  ** 									     **
10   |  **   Authors:	John Furlan, jlf@behere.com				     **

12   |  ** 		Andrew Ruder, aer@absoft.com 				     **
13   |  ** 									     **
14   |  **   Description:	Similar to a 'update' command but only refreshes     **
15   |  **			the non-persistent elements			     **
16   |  ** 									     **
17   |  **   Exports:		ModuleCmd_Refresh				     **
18   |  ** 									     **
19   |  **   Notes:								     **
20   |  ** 									     **

62   | static	char	module_name[] = __FILE__;
63   | 
64   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
65   | /**				    PROTOTYPES				     **/
66   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
67   | 
68   | /** not applicable **/
69   | 
70   | 
71   | /*++++
72   |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
73   |  ** 									     **
74   |  **   Function:		ModuleCmd_Refresh				     **
75   |  ** 									     **
76   |  **   Description:	Execution of the module-command 'refresh'	     **
77   |  **			Does only the non-persistent modules settings        **
78   |  **			(aliases)					     **
79   |  ** 									     **
80   |  **   First Edition:	2005/06/02					     **
81   |  ** 									     **
82   |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		Attached Tcl Interp. **
83   |  **			char 		*argv[]		Argument list	     **
84   |  ** 									     **
85   |  **   Result:		int	TCL_ERROR	Failure			     **
86   |  **				TCL_OK		Successful operation	     **
87   |  ** 									     **
88   |  **   Attached Globals:	specified_module	The module name
89   |  **   			g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
90   |  **					this function is called in order to  **
91   |  **					control everything		     **
92   |  **			g_current_module	The module which is handled  **
93   |  **						by the current command	     **
94   |  ** 									     **
95   |  ** ************************************************************************ **
96   |  ++++*/
97   | 
98   | int ModuleCmd_Refresh(	Tcl_Interp	*interp,
99   | 			int		 argc,
100  |                   	char		*argv[])
101  | {
102  |     Tcl_Interp	*refr_interp;
103  |     Tcl_DString	 cmdbuf;
104  |     int		 i,
105  |     		 result,
106  | 		 count;
107  |     char	*list[ MOD_BUFSIZE];
108  |     char	*files[ MOD_BUFSIZE];
109  |     char	*lmenv;
110  |     char	*loaded;
111  |     
112  |     /**
113  |      ** Begin by getting the list of loaded modules.
114  |      **/
115  |     loaded = getenv( "LOADEDMODULES" );
116  |     if (!loaded || !*loaded)
117  | 	goto success0;
118  | 
119  |     loaded = stringer(NULL,0, loaded, NULL);
120  |     if( !loaded )
121  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL))
122  | 	    goto unwind0;
123  | 
124  |     if (!(lmenv = getLMFILES(interp))) {
125  | 	if ( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_MODULE_PATH, LOC, NULL))
126  | 	    goto unwind1;
127  | 	else
128  | 	    goto success1;
129  |     }
130  | 
131  |     if (*lmenv == '\0')
132  | 	goto success1;
133  | 
134  |     count = 1;
135  |     for( list[ 0] = xstrtok( loaded, ":");
136  | 	(list[ count] = xstrtok( NULL, ":"));
137  | 	 count++ );
138  | 
139  |     count = 1;
140  |     for( files[ 0] = xstrtok( lmenv, ":");
141  | 	(files[ count] = xstrtok( NULL, ":"));
142  | 	 count++ );
143  | 
144  |     /**
145  |      **  Initialize the command buffer and set up the modules flag
146  |      **  to 'non-persist only'
147  |      **/
148  | 
149  |     Tcl_DStringInit( &cmdbuf);
150  |     g_flags |= M_NONPERSIST;
151  | 
152  |     /**
153  |      **  Handle each loaded module file. Create a Tcl interpreter for each 
154  |      **  module file to be handled and initialize it with custom module commands
155  |      **/
156  | 
157  |     for(i=0; i < count && list[i]; i++) {
158  |         /**
159  |          ** Set the name of the current module
160  |          **/
161  | 	g_specified_module = list[i];
162  | 
163  | 	refr_interp = Tcl_CreateInterp();
164  | 	if ( TCL_OK != (result = Module_Init ( refr_interp ))) {
165  | 	    Tcl_DeleteInterp( refr_interp );
166  | 	    null_free((void *) &loaded);
167  | 	    return (result);
168  | 	}
169  | 
170  | 	/**
171  | 	 **  Execute the module 
172  | 	 **/
173  | 
174  |         g_current_module = list[i];
175  | 
176  | 	result = CallModuleProcedure( refr_interp, &cmdbuf, files[i], 
177  | 	    "ModulesNonPersist", 0);
178  | 
179  | 	/**
180  | 	 **  Remove the Tcl interpreter ...
181  | 	 **/
182  | 
183  | 	Tcl_DeleteInterp( refr_interp);
184  | 
185  |     } /** for **/
186  | 
187  |     /**
188  |      **  Leave the 'nonpersist mode', free up what has been used and return
189  |      **/
190  | 
191  |     g_flags &= ~M_NONPERSIST;
192  | 
193  |     Tcl_DStringFree( &cmdbuf);
194  | 
195  | success1:
196  |     null_free((void *) &loaded);
197  | 
198  | success0:
199  |     return( TCL_OK);			/** -------- EXIT (SUCCESS) -------> **/
200  | 
201  | unwind1:
202  |     null_free((void *) &loaded);
203  | 
204  | unwind0:
205  |     return( TCL_ERROR );		/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
206  | } /** End of 'ModuleCmd_Refresh' **/
